page.title: 03Demographic composition
page.content: The demographic make-ups of Bideford Green, Linslade, and Soulbury are very different. Linslade contains a large modern housing estate of mainly young, middle class families, many of whom work in London. Houses change hands frequently as the young executives are moved round the country constantly. Soulbury started life as a small farming village but is increasingly turning into a commuter area and losing its village identity. In the last few decades the school has gone, the shops have disappeared and the Post Office closed five years ago. Now Soulbury village consists of an increasing number of commuters, many of whom do not take part in the village life and the farming community who provide a stable nucleus in the village. Many of the elderly in Soul- bury have lived there all their lives.
